short_summary: Canadian Air and Precipitation Monitoring Program - CAPMoN site in Alberta
description: The contractor will provide technical support for the CAPMoN Joussard site, including collection and analysis of precipitation and air samples, maintenance, and troubleshooting of equipment, as well as site maintenance and upkeep.
full_summary:
### Request for Proposal for CAPMoN Joussard Site Monitoring Services

**Project Overview**

Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) is seeking a contractor to provide weekly technical support services for the Canadian Air and Precipitation Monitoring Program (CAPMoN) Joussard site located in Alberta. The successful contractor will be responsible for maintaining and operating the site, collecting and processing environmental samples, and ensuring the accuracy and reliability of the data collected.

**Scope of Work**

The contractor will be required to perform the following tasks:

- Service and maintain the precipitation collector, air filter sampling system, and ozone sampling system
- Collect and package environmental samples for shipping to the CAPMoN National Laboratory
- Maintain and operate monitoring equipment, perform routine maintenance and repairs, and troubleshoot any technical issues that may arise
- Ensure the site is kept clean and free of debris, including snow removal and grass cutting

**Key Responsibilities**

- Attend to the site once a week to perform the tasks outlined above
- Ensure all tasks are performed in accordance with the CAPMoN Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)
- Maintain accurate and detailed records of all activities performed
- Collaborate with ECCC technical staff to ensure smooth operation of the site and resolve any technical issues that may arise

**Technical Requirements**

- The contractor must have a good understanding of environmental sampling procedures and equipment operation
- The contractor must be able to work independently and make decisions based on the information collected
- The contractor must have good communication skills and be able to report any technical issues or concerns to ECCC technical staff

**Proposal Requirements**

- The contractor must submit a proposal outlining their experience, qualifications, and approach to delivering the services outlined above
- The proposal must include a detailed description of the services to be provided, the methodology to be used, and any relevant qualifications and experience

**Language of Communication**

The language of communication for this proposal is English, and all documents and correspondence must be provided in English.

### Important Dates

- Tender closing date: November 28, 2022 at 15:00:00
- Proposed contract start date: None specified
- Proposed contract end date: None specified

### Contact Information

For more information, please contact Mitchell Palmer, ECCC, at mitchell.palmer@ec.gc.ca or 1 873-499-5126. For the proposal package, please visit https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/11/07/9288a
